front.title: Proposed workflow for Scientific and Learning Projects carried out as a Group

abstract.t: This memo presents a workflow for doing scientific projects in a group, especially of the technical nature related to programming, computer science and electrical engineering but NOT limited to those fields. The workflow also applies to the learning of complex knowledge with the help of peer groups, especially in the absence of a structured environment for learning without a trained instructor as is provided in Universities and Colleges.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: At various hackerspaces in and around Pune various projects are being attempted. The number of hackerspaces abound and so do the number of projects. Unfortunately all of the projects that are being attempted at various hackerspaces are usually of the beginner level and only some of them graduate to intermediate or to the advanced level.

This is a proposed framework to carry out projects and to learn complex skill sets in a self-learning group such that at the end of the project the participant has retained majority of the knowledge and is capable of attempting the same tasks with more confidence and in less amount of time (the participant having successfully climbed the learning curve in the previous iteration).

middle.section:
A project is nothing but a group of doable tasks with specific objectives each, a time constraint for performing each task and a specific structure about how to go about attempting all the tasks.
Any project that is attempted can be classified into one of the following types:-
Learning Building
A project that is going to be attempted should have the following ingredients:-
A well defined list of tasks with an objective each The number of meetings to attempt that project should not be more than five. If it seems that the number of meetings for the given project are going to be more than 5 then reconsider splitting the project into two projects.
A project is headed by a project master. The project master is the leader of the project

section.title: Group Composition
section.t: Whenever we are working in a group there is always a slight management/co-ordination overhead just because of the fact that it is a group activity. All the members of the group that are participating in the project are going to be equal participants in the project as far as the activities of learning and building are concerned. But in spite of that there will be participants who are willing to take more initiative and go the extra mile to help the project succeed. These participants will have to volunteer to take care of these meta tasks. These participants shall form the Enablers Team. The other participants will merely participate in the project helping achieve the project objectives.

section.title: The Participants
section.t: The participants in the project should be individuals who are sufficiently motivated and interested in the objectives of the project and have the pre-requisite abilities to finish the tasks in the project. The number of participants in the project should not be more than 25 people not including the Enablers.

section.title: The Enablers
section.t:
The Enablers' team will ideate, originate and enable the project. While working in a team it is best when the responsibilities of each individual are clearly defined as it helps in better execution and less interference from other members of the team. The Enablers team consists of the following members:
The Project Master Subject Matter Expert/s The Sergeant at Arms The Human Link The Treasurer

section.title: The Project Master
section.t: A project is headed by a Project Master (PM). The PM is the chief enabler of the project. He/she is not necessarily the most scientifically/technically competent participant in the project, but it is his responsibility as the creator of the project to clearly lay down the objectives of the project and determine its overall structure. It is the PM's responsibility to build the Enablers' Team to assist him in successfully enabling the project. The other role-players should be competent and motivated enough to discharge their duties. If under any circumstances they are unable to do so, the PM has to step in and discharge their duties in addition to his existing ones. It is also his responsibility to involve the subject matter expert/s while creating the structure of the project.

section.title: Subject Matter Expert/s
section.t: A Subject Matter Expert (SME) is someone who has done work which is similar/related to the work being done in the current project. He/she should be reasonably be more confident about the subject than the rest of the participants. He/she should have a fair and reasonable idea as to challenges that will be faced in the course of the project. He/she shall be primarily responsible for the structure of the project and its planning. During the project his role will be that of a mentor. If the SME is himself/herself a novice, then it is his/her duty to prepare reasonably well in advance and be prepared to help/guide others during the project meetings.

There can be more than one Subject Matter Experts for a project. More than one Subject Matter Experts maybe required for an extremely complex project, but most of the intermediate level and even the advanced projects need only one subject matter expert. Having more than subject matter expert/s when not required will not lighten the burden instead it will create more confusion and stale-mates within the Project Team.

section.title: The Sergeant-at-Arms
section.t: The Sergeant at Arms (SAA) is responsible for the infrastructure and logistics of the project in question. He/she has to make sure that the necessary permissions for carrying out the project at the venue have been acquired and the apparatus needed for doing the project is ready for use and well-tested. It is expected of the SAA within reasonable limits to have alternative backups in place if the primary apparatus fails.

section.title: The Human Link
section.t: The Human Link (HL) is responsible for making sure that an interested audience is aware of the project taking place. He/she has to make sure that the project participants are on the same page about project meeting venue and timings. The HL is primarily responsible for communication between the Enablers and rest of the Participants.

section.title: The Treasurer
section.t: The Treasurer is responsible for the finance management of the project if any. Some projects might not need a treasurer at all in case if no money is involved. But a person separate than the SAA is recommended for handling the finances of the project if they are significant.

There is no hard and fast rule that each of the roles defined above have to be done by separate individuals. It is perfectly okay for one individual to perform multiple roles or to perform all these roles, but it is better and recommended that the responsibilities are divided to avoid a burnout and to keep process of doing these projects from dying out. Also the involvement of multiple individuals in the process makes sure that a community feeling is fostered and the process continues to live even if individuals leave the community. The reason why this process has been proposed is to stop the decline that that community faces once the individuals who led it have to leave it.
